events.originalText: The Manawan Police Academy in Lahore, Pakistan, was attacked and held for several hours by 12 gunmen, resulting in 16 deaths and 95 injuries.
events.subtitle: Lahore
events.headline: Manawan Police Academy in Lahore, Pakistan, Attacked by 12 Gunmen: 16 Dead, 95 Injured

events.originalText: John HinckleyÂ Jr. shot and wounded U.S. president Ronald Reagan and three others outside the Washington Hilton (immediate aftermath pictured).
events.subtitle: John Hinckley Jr.
events.headline: John Hinckley Jr. Shoots U.S. President Ronald Reagan Outside Washington Hilton

events.originalText: Vietnam War: North Vietnamese forces began the Easter Offensive in an attempt to gain as much territory and destroy as many South Vietnamese units as possible.
events.subtitle: Vietnam War
events.headline: North Vietnamese Forces Launch Easter Offensive in Vietnam War

events.originalText: Jeopardy!, the popular American game show created by Merv Griffin, made its debut on the NBC television network.
events.subtitle: Jeopardy!
events.headline: Jeopardy! Game Show Debuts on NBC Television Network

events.originalText: Usmar Ismail began shooting Darah dan Doa, widely recognised as the first Indonesian film.
events.subtitle: Usmar Ismail
events.headline: First Indonesian Film Darah dan Doa Begins Shooting by Usmar Ismail

events.originalText: The Australian Air Corps was disbanded, to be replaced the following day by the Australian Air Force.
events.subtitle: Australian Air Corps
events.headline: Australian Air Corps Disbanded, Replaced by Australian Air Force

events.originalText: Four days of inter-ethnic clashes broke out in Baku, Azerbaijan, resulting in about 12,000 deaths.
events.subtitle: March Days
events.headline: Inter-Ethnic Clashes in Baku, Azerbaijan, Result in 12,000 Deaths

events.originalText: Sultan Abd al-Hafid signed the Treaty of Fes, making Morocco a French protectorate.
events.subtitle: Abd al-Hafid of Morocco
events.headline: Morocco Becomes French Protectorate with Treaty of Fes Signed by Sultan Abd al-Hafid

events.originalText: U.S. secretary of state William H. Seward negotiated the purchase of Alaska from Russia for US$7.2 million.
events.subtitle: William H. Seward
events.headline: Alaska Purchased from Russia by U.S. for US$7.2 Million

events.originalText: British chemist William Crookes published his discovery of thallium using flame spectroscopy.
events.subtitle: William Crookes
events.headline: Chemist William Crookes Discovers Thallium Using Flame Spectroscopy

events.originalText: American physician Crawford Long became the first person to use diethyl ether as an anesthetic in a surgical procedure.
events.subtitle: Crawford Long
events.headline: Physician Crawford Long Uses Diethyl Ether as Anesthetic in Surgical Procedure

events.originalText: The United States merged East Florida and West Florida to create the Florida Territory.
events.subtitle: East Florida
events.headline: Florida Territory Created by Merger of East Florida and West Florida
